meanings.sent1: In a stound, the bus arrived at the stop.
meanings.sent2: I only have a stound to finish my homework before dinner.
meanings.sent3: At the last stound, I found my lost keys in the couch cushions.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset only lasted a stound before darkness fell.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of children filled the park for a joyful stound.

meanings.definition: To astonish or overwhelm with shock or grief.
meanings.sent2: The magician's trick never fails to stound the audience.
meanings.sent3: His sudden appearance at the party stounded everyone.
meanings.sent4: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop stounded the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder stounded the sleeping cat.
